section.title: Enabling a Proxy for Notifications
section.p: If your environment requires a proxy address in order for communications to function then these steps will show you how you can enable one.

These steps will require access to the lifecycle manager in your cloud deployment so you may need to contact your Administrator. You can make these changes during the initial configuration phase prior to the first installation or you can modify your existing environment, the only difference being the last step.

ol.li: Log in to the lifecycle manager.

Edit ~/helion/hos/ansible/roles/monasca-notification/defaults/main.yml file and at the bottom of the file add this line with your proxy address values: notification_environment: '"http_proxy=http://your_proxy:8080" "https_proxy=http://your_proxy:8080"' There are single quotation marks around the entire value of this entry and then double quotation marks around the individual proxy entries. This formatting must exist when you enter these values into your configuration file.

Edit ~/helion/hos/ansible/roles/monasca-notification/templates/monasca-notification.service.j2 file and underneath the [Service] section add the line below: [Service] Environment={{ notification_environment }}

If you are making these chnages prior to your intial installation then you are done and can continue on with the installation. However, if you are modifying an existing environment, you will need to run the Monasca reconfigure playbook to enable these changes: cd ~/scratch/ansible/next/hos/ansible ansible-playbook -i hosts/verb_hosts monasca-reconfigure.yml --tags notification
Log in to the Operations Console. See Connecting to the Operations Console for more details.
Use the navigation menu to go to the Notification Methods page:
By default you should see an email method. To create a new method just select the Create Notification Method button.

On the Create Notification Method window you have the following options:
Name - Enter a unique name value for the notification method you are creating.
Type - Choose a type. Available values are Webhook, Email, or Pager Duty.
Address/Key - Enter the value corresponding to the type you chose.
Once those values are entered, select the Create Notification button.

section.title: Applying a Notification Method to an Alarm Definition

ol.li: Log in to the Operations Console. See Connecting to the Operations Console for more details.
Use the navigation menu to go to the Alarm Creation page:
Locate the alarm you want to change the notification method for. You can use the sorting methods for assistance.
Once you have found the alarm you want to change the notification method for, click on the menu to the right of the alarm and choose the Edit option:
Edit the Alarm Notifications window to match the notification method(s) you want for this alarm and then select the Update Alarm button:
Repeat as needed until all of your alarms have the notification methods you desire.
